label: individual time trial (cycling)
definition: A race or stage against the clock with each cyclist setting off individually

label: Keirin

label: Madison race
definition: A points race by teams comprising two cyclists in relay-format

label: mountain biking
definition: All-terrain, off-road bicycle riding requiring endurance and specially adapted mountain bikes

label: points race (cycling)
definition: Cyclists aim to complete the highest number of laps. Bonus points are picked up in intermediate sprints held every 2500m

label: road cycling
definition: Road race with all competitors starting en masse.

label: cycling staging race
definition: Race disputed by teams with the classifications determined by the combined times over a day

label: team cycle sprint
definition: A track race where two teams race against each other, starting on opposite sides of the track, following the first lap the first rider pulls away, leaving the second rider to lead the next lap, who then does the same at the last lap, leaving the third rider to finish the race. label: road cycling team pursuit
definition: Track cycle event where two teams set off from midway down opposite straights and try to make up the gap between them

label: team time trial (cycling)
definition: Teams of cyclists race against the clock

label: track race (cycling)
definition: A race staged on a track in a velodrome

label: competitive dancing
definition: Dancing competition where competitors are judged on technique and interpretation.

label: darts
definition: The sport in which small darts are thrown at a dartboard, a circular target divided into numbered sections.

label: diving
definition: Competitors dive off a fixed or spring board and are assessed by seven judges giving marks up to ten for their acrobatic moves.

label: platform diving
definition: Divers take off from a high platform

label: springboard diving
definition: Divers dive from a high springboard.

label: synchronised diving
definition: Two competitors from the same team dive off at the same time from separate platforms or springboards. As well as being judged on the standard criteria they are also awarded marks for synchronisation.

label: scuba diving
definition: Underwater diving with the use of a self-contained underwater breathing apparatus

label: underwater sports
definition: Competitive sports played under water

label: dog racing
definition: Dogs racing around a track

label: oval track dog racing
definition: Pursuing an artificial rabbit around an oval track

label: dog sled racing
definition: Race with dogs harnessed to a sled

label: duathlon
definition: An athletic event involving running and cycling

label: equestrian
definition: Horse-based sport disciplines governed by the International Federation for Equestrian Sports, such as dressage, eventing, show jumping and vaulting

label: cross-country horse riding
definition: Equestrian event held on a designated circuit in the countryside featuring artificial and natural obstacles.

label: dressage
definition: A rider is judged on a series of moves at three different paces - walk, trot and gallop.

label: horse jumping
definition: A rider and horse attempt to jump a series of obstacles in an enclosed arena against the clock.

label: three day eventing
definition: Equestrian event involving three disciplines - Dressage, cross-country and show jumping

label: horse driving
definition: Equestrian events involving horses being driven in harness, single vehicle around a course.

label: fencing
definition: Combat sport using a sword or foil.

label: epee
definition: Category of fencing using a weapon with a triangular cross-section blade and a large bell guard

label: foil
definition: Category of fencing using a weapon with a rectangular cross-section blade and a small bell guard

label: sabre
definition: A fencing weapon with a flat blade and knuckle guard used with cutting or thrusting moves

label: field hockey
definition: A ball sport involving two teams of 11 players using curved sticks. The aim is to score as many goals as possible.

label: figure skating
definition: To obtain the best marks possible from nine judges who award scores after two prepared sections - both skated to music - during which competitors must attempt to achieve the greatest possible harmony between artistic flair and technical precision.

label: ice dance
definition: Takes place over three days with, in order, two compulsory dances, the original dance (2min 30sec) and the free dance (4min).

label: fist ball
definition: Men's team sport similar to volleyball (with a much lower net) executed mainly in gymnastics clubs

label: floorball
definition: Played indoors in a court the size of a basketball court. 6 players per team, of which one is a goalkeeper. He/she operates kneeling but there is no goal-stick like in ice hockey. The players use plastic clubs and a light plastic ball to pass and shot goal

label: flying disc
definition: A group of events all played with a flying plastic disc. The exact regulation for the disc is different in different events but it has to be unbroken of solid plastic and a production model with no modification. Flying disc is sometimes called Frisbee.

label: Gaelic football
definition: A form of football played by two teams of 15 competing on a pitch by running with, kicking and passing a spherical ball. Points are scored by moving the ball between goal posts. Governed by the Gaelic Athletic Association.

label: golf
definition: A game to hit a small hard ball with different clubs around a course of typically 18 holes varying in distance and during a round. The object, depending on the scoring formulae, is to make the fewest strokes possible

label: mini golf
definition: A game where small hard balls must be holed on an artificial course in as few strokes from the club as possible

label: gymnastics
definition: A sport consisting of a variety of disciplines in which gymnasts perform artistic and acrobatic moves using different apparatus.

label: ball (rhythmic gymnastics)
definition: An exercise based on suppleness of the body using a ball.

label: beam (artistic gymnastics)
definition: Gymnasts perform leaps and flips from the much feared balance beam just 10 cm wide.

label: clubs (rhythmic gymnastics)
definition: Dance and gymnastic moves whilst juggling clubs.

label: floor exercise (artistic gymnastics)
definition: A gymnastics floor exercise on a 12m/sq matt.

label: hoop (rhythmic gymnastics)
definition: A hoop is rolled and thrown whilst performing a dance routine.

label: horizontal bar (artistic gymnastics)
definition: Gymnasts turn, spin and perform pirouettes around the horizontal bar.

label: parallel bars (artistic gymnastics)
definition: Gymnasts swing and turn with guile and grace around the parallel bars.

label: pommel horse (artistic gymnastics)
definition: Gymnasts perform an uninterrupted swing motion over a handled horse using balance and strength

label: rhythmic gymnastics
definition: Mixture of dance and gymnastic moves

label: ribbon (rhythmic gymnastics)
definition: Gymnasts work through a pre-arranged routine whilst manipulating a spectacular length of ribbon.

label: rings (artistic gymnastics)
definition: Gymnasts perform feats of balance and strength from two suspended rings.

label: rope (rhythmic gymnastics)
definition: Jump and figure movements are performed while a rope is manipulated.

label: trampoline
definition: Competitors perform complicated twists and turns whilst bouncing on the trampoline.

label: uneven bars (artistic gymnastics)
definition: Gymnasts run through an airborne routine swinging around and between the uneven bars.

label: vault (artistic gymnastics)
definition: Gymnasts propel themselves by jumping on a trampoline after running quickly down a 25m lane

label: handball (team)
definition: A ball game using the hands contested by two teams of seven trying to throw the ball into the opponents goal.

label: hornuss
definition: Swiss team sport with 16 or 18 men per team. A rubber puck is hit towards the field of the adversary team which tries to hit the puck in the air with a wooden board thrown in the air

label: horse racing
definition: Mounted horse races.

label: flat racing
definition: A horse race over a flat course.

label: harness racing
definition: Horses hitched to a jockeyed buggy race round a flat course. Can be performed at a trotting gait or a pacing gait.

label: steeple chase
definition: A mounted horse race over at least eight classic obstacles, four of which must be different, such as the water jump, spruce fences, mud walls etc.

label: hurling

label: ice hockey
definition: Two teams of six heavily padded skaters try and outscore each other by hitting a puck into the opponents goal.

label: sledge hockey
definition: Like ice hockey but instead of skates small sledges are used. Competitors move by pushing with the arms

label: inline skating
definition: Competitive sports using inline skates

label: Jai Alai (Pelota)
definition: A fast ball play using either the bare hand or a wicker scoop in an arena of walls of different outlay and size

label: judo
definition: A defensive martial art.

label: extra lightweight (judo)

label: half-heavyweight (judo)

label: lightweight (judo)

label: middleweight (judo)

label: kabaddi

label: K2 (kayaking)

label: K4 (kayaking)

label: karate

definition: Japanese traditional martial art using a bamboo sword, sometimes called Japanese fencing

label: kyudo
definition: Japanese traditional martial art using a bamboo bow and arrows, sometimes called Japanese archery

label: lacrosse

label: modern pentathlon
definition: The Modern Pentathlon comprises five events run over a single day in the following order: shooting, fencing, swimming, horse riding and running.

label: motorboat racing

label: motor car racing
definition: Racing with cars

definition: Races for one or more drivers over a long and set distance or time

label: Formula One
definition: Single cockpit car racing where 20 or so competitors race head to head over varied circuits around the world to win Grand Prix points in an individual and constructors championship

label: Indy Racing
definition: North American top range professional league speed racing over circuits.

label: motor car rallycross
definition: Stage races over dirt tracks

label: motor car rallying
definition: A season of endurance races over closed circuits including dirt tracks, roads and even snowy conditions featuring specials using adapted road cars with a driver and co-pilot.

label: motorcycling
definition: Races with 2, 3 or 4 wheels vehicles with a saddle and handlebars

label: motorcycle endurance
definition: A road race of consistency and endurance

label: enduro
definition: A race of speed, endurance and regularity over varied surfaces such as through forests and on dirt tracks

label: grass-track
definition: A race competed on turf

label: moto-ball
definition: Team sport where drivers play a ball

label: moto-cross
definition: Raced over dirt tracks featuring severe mounds

label: motoGP

label: motorcycle rallying
definition: Races run over regular roads

label: side-cars

label: motorcycling trial

label: naginata
definition: Japanese traditional martial art using a pole sword made of wood. 'Naginata' means a spear with a curved blade

label: netball
definition: A woman's sport similar to basketball though without a board behind the basket

label: power boating

definition: Rodeo discipline

definition: Rodeo discipline

definition: Rodeo discipline

definition: Rodeo discipline

label: saddle bronc
definition: Rodeo discipline

label: roller hockey
definition: Team sport similar to ice hockey, executed on 4 wheel roller skates with sticks and a ball

label: rowing
definition: Boat racing usually on flat calm waters with boats for 1, 2, 4 or 8 rowers

label: coxed pair
definition: Two person boats with just one oar each and with a team mate to give directions

label: coxless four
definition: Four person boats with just one oar each and without a team mate to give directions

definition: Two person boats with just one oar each and without a team mate to give directions

definition: Eight person boats with just one oar each and with a team mate to give directions

label: single sculls
definition: Single person boats with two oars

label: rugby union

label: rugby sevens
definition: A type of rugby union where two teams of 7 compete on a pitch by running with and passing an oval ball. Points are scored by touching down the ball behind the goal line or kicking it between goal posts. Governed by the World Rugby organization.

label: sailing
definition: Sailing boat racing over a route

label: multihull
definition: Sailing boats with multiple hulls

label: dinghy
definition: Single hulled vessel without a fixed keel

label: keelboat
definition: Single hulled vessel with a fixed keel

label: sailing regatta
definition: Sailing event

label: ocean sailing
definition: Sailing vessels across oceans as part of a competitive race.

definition: Sailing vessels around the world as a race

definition: Sailing oceans as an individual, as part of a race.

label: shinty

label: pistol shooting
definition: Shooting event using a pistol

label: rifle shooting
definition: Shooting event using a rifle

label: running target shooting

label: shotgun shooting
definition: Shooting event using a shotgun

definition: A winter sport using different types of skis

label: grass skiing

label: Nordic skiing

label: snooker

label: snowboarding
definition: Practiced with a single board (rather than two skis)

label: breaststroke
definition: Swimming style , on the front, effecting forward and outward push movements with the arms and backward and outward pushes with the legs

label: medley swimming

label: marathon swimming

label: relay medley swimming
definition: Team relay race involving a combination of four different swimming styles

label: short course swimming

label: synchronised free routine

label: Taekwon-Do
